In the interlayer diffusion method, a stack of multiple layers of different compositions is deposited. The solid-state reaction occurs in two steps
11, 12 , interdiffusion of the reactants and nucleation/crystallization of end products, and it normally results in crystalline materials. However, if one component of the alloy diffuses much faster than the other components, the crystallization of the new structure is hindered
13 , and thus a crystal-to-glass transition occurs. The interlayer diffusion method is of great importance from both fundamental science and engineering application
14 standpoints.
